intro: Streptanthus glandulosus var. niger, commonly known as the black glandular streptanthus, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes many other flowering plants with distinctive four-petaled flowers. The plant is characterized by its glandular hairs on the stems and leaves, which give it a fuzzy appearance. It produces small, yellowish-white flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The variety var. niger is distinguished by its dark-colored flowers and unique morphological traits.
